meanings.definition: To shout or call loudly to someone or something in order to attract attention.
meanings.sent1: The children were holloaing for their lost dog in the park.
meanings.sent2: The coach was holloaing instructions to the players during the game.
meanings.sent3: The parrot started holloaing back at the noisy neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The wind was holloaing through the trees, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The lifeguard holloaing warnings to the swimmers caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: The act of shouting or calling loudly to someone or something in order to attract attention.
meanings.sent1: The holloaing of the fans could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent2: The holloaing of the protesters echoed through the streets.
meanings.sent3: The holloaing of the auctioneer added excitement to the event.
meanings.sent4: The holloaing of the seagulls signaled the approach of the storm.
meanings.sent5: The holloaing of the teacher quieted the noisy classroom.
